FacilityName: Great Lakes Cheese of Tennessee, Inc.

_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Dairy Product (except Dried or Canned) Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Great Lakes Cheese of Tennessee processes a variety of cheese products at our facility in Manchester. Great Lakes Cheese has a strong commitment to operate our facility in a safe and responsible manner.

 

Ammonia is used at our facility as a refrigerant. Similar to the function Freon plays in a home or car air conditioning system, ammonia is used to cool the air in our product coolers. The ammonia is contained in a closed loop system.  In other words, it is designed to remain inside the piping and vessels in our facility.  Ammonia is a safe and efficient cooling choice for our operation.

 

A. Describe the Accident Release Prevention and Emergency Policies

 

Great Lakes Cheese takes many precautions to prevent or minimize accidental releases of ammonia from the refrigeration system. These precautions include safety controls (alarms and automatic shutdown devices) which are designed to identify and prevent potentially unsafe conditions like pressure increases that could cause a system failure. We also have a preventive maintenance program designed to maintain the on-going integrity of the system.  Only qualified contractors work on ammonia equipment.

 

The Maintenance Manager is responsible for the management of the ammonia safety program.

 



B. Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled

 

Ammonia is the only substance covered by the Accidental Release Prevention Regulations.

 



C. Description of the Accidental Release Prevention Program

 

The facility has an accident release prevention program that complies with both OSHA's Process Safety Management Standard and the EPA's Risk Management Program Regulation. The prevention program consists of the following elements:

 

- Employee Participation Program 

- Process Safety Information 

- Process Hazard Analysis 

- Operating Procedures

- Training Program

- Contractor Safety Program

- Pre-Startup Safety Review Procedures

- Mechanical Integrity Program

- Hot Work Permit Procedures

- Manage

ment of Change Procedures

- Incident Investigation Procedures

- Compliance Audit Procedures

 

D. Five-Year Accident History

 

There have been no reportable accidents at this site.





E. Description of the Emergency Response Program

 

An emergency response program has been implemented at the Manchester facility. The program has been coordinated with the Manchester Fire and Rescue Department.

 



G. Planned Changes to Improve Safety

 

Great Lakes Cheese is committed to operating our ammonia refrigeration system in a safe and responsible manner. We are continually evaluating our equipment and procedures to meet this objective.
